sect1.title: Introduction To The Module Manager
sect1.para: The "module" is the unit of content in GnomeSword, and Sword generally; a Sword module is a resource available for viewing in Sword applications. There are several varieties: Most importantly, Bible texts, as well as dictionaries and lexicons, commentaries, and general books, including some which have graphical content (e.g. atlases). They are retrieved either from a local directory structure (such as a CDROM distribution) or remotely via ftp from a server such as Crosswire, which is the home of Sword, and from which all officially Sword-sanctioned modules are available.
If you have other Sword applications installed, they will all share the same set of Sword modules that you install through the Module Manager.

sect2.title: Sword Module Installations
sect2.para: After you have selected your Install Source, click the Refresh button to cause GnomeSword to find the module summary available from that source before moving on.
